importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on this day, and video evidence shows it was parked near the location where her body was later found.
The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date, two weeks after her disappearance. This marks a significant breakthrough in the investigation and the culmination of a multi-week search.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on this date, and its subsequent appearance on video and at a fire site ties directly to the timeline of Scott’s disappearance and the investigation.

The timeframe from Scott’s disappearance on Oct. 4 to the discovery of her remains on Oct. 20 spans the critical period during which the investigation unfolded, including the theft, use, and subsequent fire of the vehicle.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for about two weeks, were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
The discovery was prompted by an anonymous tip that led investigators to re-examine the site where they previously searched, resulting in the identification of the remains through DNA testing.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and potentially homicide.
King’s cellphone location data and video evidence indicate he had contact with Scott and used a stolen Hyundai Accent, which was seen parked near the scene of her disappearance.
The car was later found on fire and compacted at a junkyard, preventing full examination, but video footage supports the connection to the case.
Prosecutors say more charges are in the works, and they have reason to believe other individuals may have been involved after the fact, indicating the case is still under active investigation.

Scott, who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a source of light, kindness, and a beautiful spirit; they described their hearts as 'shattered' and requested prayers.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for about two weeks, were discovered behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, confirmed through DNA testing. The discovery followed an anonymous tip prompting a re-examination of the site. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence including cellphone location data and video footage of a stolen Hyundai Accent—seen parked near the scene—links King to the case. The vehicle was later found on fire and compacted, limiting forensic analysis. Prosecutors say additional charges are pending and suspect possible involvement of others. The case remains under investigation, with ongoing legal proceedings and public concern due to the tragic nature of Scott’s disappearance and the severity of the charges against King.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
